data.description:
The VR4VET Blue Sector VR app simulates an area of a fjord with several fish cages, a feeding station, a fish health and welfare station, and a fish processing facility. The users can experience situations representing typical workplaces in the aquaculture and fish processing industries, such as feeding salmon in multiple cages, inspecting fish for injuries and diseases, and sorting, cutting, and packaging fish in a factory.
The application can be used as a supplementary material for the end users integrated into the career guidance and vocational education practice. When in the application, the user takes the role of a trainee at various workplaces in the blue economy sectors, those related to the oceans, seas and coasts. The user is introduced to the professions and can engage in typical workplace tasks.
The app features:
- Fish feeding station, where the user can observe salmon in three fish cages using a special underwater camera, adjust the feeding intensity to keep the fish well fed without wasting the food, and get feedback on their performance.
- Fish welfare station, where the user can observe a typical procedure in aquaculture when a sample of fish is checked for diseases and injuries. The user can perform the check and get feedback on their performance.
- Fish processing facility, where the user can observe how the salmon is received, sorted, processed, packaged and shipped for delivery. The user can perform several typical tasks and get feedback on their performance.

changelog.change_log:
Blue Sector v1.3. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario, and a fish factory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We integrated the fish maintenance scenario into the Blue Sector app. The new scenario consists of tasks such as repairing the fish cage, manually feeding the fish, and discarding dead fish pumped from the cage.
- We added touch screen functionality to the virtual tablet, allowing the player to interact with the tablet user interface by using their index finger.
- We added an inventory which allows transportation of objects between scenes. It can be opened by pressing the Y-button on the left hand controller.

## Changed:
- We reworked the virtual tablet so that  the player can more easily keep track of the progress and the current objectives. The user interface of the tablet is also simplified. The updated tablet is now available in the fish factory scenario with the corresponding skills, tasks, subtasks and steps.
- We updated the logic of the fish behavior in the fish feeding scenario. The fish will swim upwards only when they are hungry and the feeding intensity is set to high.
- The food wastage UI bar does not appear completely empty when there is zero waste in the fish feeding scenario.

## Fixed:
- We fixed the issue where the hands would stretch when grabbing objects in the fish factory scenario.
- We fixed the issue where live fish never appeared in the bleeding station of the factory.

Blue Sector v1.2.1. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, and a fish factory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We added an NPC in the fish feeding scenario that lets the user travel to the welfare or factory scenarios using the motorboat.
- We replaced some and added better furniture in the fish feeding scenario.
- We integrated the fish factory scenario into Blue Sector, consisting of three new areas; the HSE (Health, Security and Environment) station, the bleeding station, and the gutting station. 
- We added lights in the wardrobe in the fish feeding scenario.
- We added a way to teleport from the start tutorial to the new factory scenario.

## Changed:
- We replaced the fish cage model to improve the performance and visuals.
- We remodelled the house with better looking materials and architecture.
- We added new and improved lighting in the fish feeding and fish welfare scenarios.
- We improved the visual realism of the fish tanks.

## Fixed:
- We fixed the issue where the sorting machine provided sound feedback too late after sorting a bad fish.
- The semi-transparent dialog screen of the NPC will now be resized back to the default upon clicking the “Speak” button.
- We replaced the pixelated metal material used in the fish factory scenario.
- We fixed the issue where some user interface elements disappeared.
- We improved the performance in the fish feeding scenario.
- We removed the debug menu from the start tutorial scene. Only the main menu opens when the player presses the X button.
- We replaced the hand controller images with a proper image of the Quest 2 hand controllers in the main menu.
- We fixed the issue where the main menu appears in front of the player after an initial delay; the main menu now appears in front of the player instantly.
- We prevented the NPC dialogue from starting over again by adding a “Speak” button when the dialogue has reached its end, giving the player the option to restart it at their convenience.
- We stopped the NPC from playing its talking animation when not talking.
- Updated the tablet to fix the pagination issues that caused elements to overflow outside the tablet screen.

## Developer:
- The player can now teleport on the stairs without falling through the floor using the emulator in the Unity editor.
- We reduced the number of fish from 300 to 200.
- The fish cage model is no longer in .gitignore as the new model is produced in-house with no licensing issues.

Added:
- We added two characters in the fish feed scenario. One of them welcomes the user outdoors and introduces the workplace, while the other  waits for the user in the fish feed control on the second floor of the building.
- We added text and audio in English, German and Dutch, in addition to the previously available content in Norwegian. The user can now switch the language in the main menu.
- We added the main menu. The menu allows pausing the app, changing language, changing the sound volume, and exiting the app. The menu can be called by clicking on the X button on the controller.
- We added a start scene with a tutorial. From the start scene, the user can teleport to the fish feed scenario scene.


Changed:
- We replaced the fish models in the welfare scenario to improve performance.
- We simplified fish models for the fish feeding scenario to improve performance.
- We replace the fish cage model in both fish feeding and welfare scenarios to improve performance.
- In the fish feeding scenario, we opened a door leading to a future warehouse room in the building.
- We replaced the decorative coffee mug model in the feeding scenario. 


Fixed:
- Fish leaving tank in welfare scenario
- We fixed the issue with fish stretching across tanks in the welfare scenario.
- We fixed the issue with the small boat that teleports the user between the feeding and welfare scenarios. The user no longer falls under water when attempting to teleport. Opening the main menu no longer makes the small boats sink or hover.
- Fish no longer collide with the player in the welfare scenario.
- Fish can no longer be pocketed in the welfare scenario.
- Fish no longer floats above the tanks in the welfare scenario.
- Fish no longer stretch uncontrollably when teleporting while holding a fish in the welfare scenario.
- Fish no longer stretch and fly uncontrollably when grabbed.
- Score can no longer become negative in the welfare scenario.
- All tutorial pop ups in the feeding scenario are translated properly.
- Objects can now be grabbed after scene transitions.
- Same hand is used for pointing in both scenarios.
- Monitor HUD in the feeding scenario changes instantly when choosing difficulty.
- Objects are more responsive when handled in the feeding scenario.
- The anesthetic levels of fish tanks in the welfare scenario no longer increase unless the stream from the bottle actually hits a tank.
